abstract.p: Edwin Eppich letter responds to Sept 19 article on rising costs of laser eye surgery

block.p: Your Sept. 19 news article about Hartford's rising costs associated with its coverage of laser eye surgery as an employee benefit terms the procedure as cosmetic and not usually medically necessary. This is a questionable categorization of the procedure and of the motives of those who choose to undergo it.

Your Sept. 19 news article about Hartford's rising costs associated with its coverage of laser eye surgery as an employee benefit terms the procedure as cosmetic and not usually medically necessary. This is a questionable categorization of the procedure and of the motives of those who choose to undergo it.

Presumably, the notion of cosmetic arises because, when successful, the procedure eliminates the need for glasses and contact lenses. As someone who is contemplating such surgery, I would urge that we consider the idea that people get the operation in order to see better -- surely not a luxury.
To take your characterization a bit further, we may as well decry ear surgeries as indulging the vain conceits of people with hearing aids.
